pageTitle: Tour of Britain comes to London

title.title: Tour of Britain comes to London

texts: On Sunday 5 September London will play host to the final leg of the Tour of Britain cycle race. An estimated 50,000 spectators will come out to watch the finest cyclists in the world compete against each other. Some central London roads will be closed to traffic for the race and will remain closed until crowds have dispersed.
On the same day there will be a festival of events on Regent Street. Therefore Regent Street will be closed to all traffic including buses from about 0400 on Sunday until 0200 on Monday 6 September.
People are advised to avoid the following roads and to allow extra time for their journeys.
To accommodate the Tour of Britain the following roads will be closed at certain times:

towards Elephant and Castle - From 0500 until last night busFrom Strand at Trafalgar Square buses will then be diverted via Northumberland Avenue, Victoria Embankment, Bridge Street to Parliament Square then follow usual route."]]}

The five legs are as follows:

Stage 1 - Wednesday, September 1

Start at Sports City in Manchester with a route that takes in Lancashire and finishes at Urbis in Corporation Street, Manchester.

Stage 2 - Thursday, September 2

Start in Millennium Square, Leeds and race through Yorkshire to finish in Pinstone Street, Sheffield.

Stage 3 - Friday, September 3

Start at Bakewell Agricultural Centre and race through Derbyshire, Leicestershire and Nottinghamshire with the finish on Victoria Embankment in Nottingham.

Stage 4 - Saturday, September 4

Start at the Celtic Manor and race through Newport and South East Wales with the finish in on the new Southern Distributor Road Bridge in Newport.

Stage 5 - Sunday, September 5 from 3pm to approx 4.30pm.

45 laps of a circuit where the riders race clockwise from the start in Whitehall, into Northumberland Avenue, down the Embankment, into Bridge Street and finish in Whitehall.
